list_definition.definition: whatever happens by chance or (good or bad) luck

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Who knows what fortune may bring?
That ring must be worth a fortune!

list_ex_of_english: With the exception of some posts in the judiciary, public office in the nineteenth century did not provide the occupants with notable fortunes.
They were children and played together, but his change of fortunes has taken him out of her social sphere.
They care more about the party than any individual in it, and will vote to maximize the party's fortunes.
Rathmines was one such suburb, whose standing rose through the century as the centre's fortunes declined.
Even as the political fortunes of the ruling authorities varied, trade and commerce continued with vigour.
The family, in spite of declining fortunes, retained some political influence in the locality.
The fortunes of the undowried were far more precarious.
